thread.title: Detroit Tigers name minor league players of the year
thread.title_full: Detroit Tigers name minor league players of the year

author: freep.com
title: Detroit Tigers name minor league players of the year
text:
MORE Mike Gerber and Joe Jimenez are the Tigers’ minor league players of the year, the team announced Wednesday.
Gerber, 22, hit .292 with 13 home runs and 76 RBIs this season for Class-A West Michigan. He is one of seven Tigers that will participate in the Arizona Fall League, which starts next week.
Jimenez, 20, posted a 1.47 ERA in 40 games with the WhiteCaps, saving 17 games. In 43 innings, he struck out 71 batters and had a 0.79 WHIP.
Jimenez will play winter ball in Puerto Rico. He was the organization’s representative in the All-Star Futures game earlier this season in Cincinnati.
Gerber was the team’s 15th-round selection in the 2014 MLB draft out of Creighton. He will be joined in the Arizona Fall League by Tigers right-hander Jeff Ferrell and prospects Austin Kubitza, Adam Ravenelle, Montreal Robertson, Dominic Ficociello and JaCoby Jones on the Scottsdale Scorpions.
Kubitza, last season’s minor league pitcher of the year, had a 5.79 ERA in 27 starts with Double-A Erie this year.
Ficociello was recently named a minor league Gold Glove Award. He posted a .996 fielding percentage in 102 games with the SeaWolves, committing four errors in 979 chances.
